title: Facebook takes down Trump campaign ad that featured symbol once used by the Nazis
text: Facebook has removed a campaign advert by Donald Trump and Mike Pence that featured a symbol once used by Nazis.

title: Facebook Removes Trump Ads for Violating Hate Policy
text: Facebook Inc. has removed a series of ads shared by President Donald Trump's campaign for violating the company's policy against "organized hate." Brandi Collins-Dexter, senior campaign director at civil rights group Color of Change, explains why she thinks the social network hasn't done enough. She speaks on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook removes Trump re-election ads that feature a Nazi symbol
text: The social media giant had been facing increased pressure to take a stronger stance against the president’s hateful rhetoric

title: Facebook To Invest $200 Million In Black-Owned Businesses, Part Of $1.1 Billion Social Justice Commitment
text: Facebook is investing $200 million to support Black-owned businesses, Black creators and nonprofits supporting the Black community, building on earlier investments and part of a broader $1.1 billion investment in Black and diverse suppliers and communities in the US. Thursday’s announcement,  amidst a growing push by U.S. companies to support racial justice, includes a new $100

title: Facebook acquires crowdsourced mapping company Mapillary
text: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Facebook Inc on Thursday acquired Swedish mapping technology company Mapillary, which collects images from tens of thousands of contributors to build immersive and up-to-date maps, the companies said.

title: Facebook outlines plans to increase workforce diversity
text: Facebook’s Sheryl Sandberg on Thursday outlined plans to improve minority representation in the higher ranks of the company. In a blog post on the social network’s website, the chief operating officer said Facebook will have 30 percent more people of color, including 30 percent more black employees, in leadership positions within the next five years.

title: Facebook taking down Trump ads ‘exposed just how biased they are’: GOP Rep
text: Rep. Guy Reschenthaler, R-Pa., reacts to Facebook taking down Trump reelection campaign ads for ‘violating our policy against organized hate.’ #Facebook

title: Facebook, Google, Amazon Could Face EU Tax by End of 2020
text: The U.S. pulled out of global talks aimed at revamping the tax code to reflect the digital world.

title: Facebook Goes After Data Scrapers Via 2 Lawsuits
text: Facebook filed lawsuits in Spain and the U.S. in what it says is the first time it used multiple jurisdictions to enforce its Terms of Service.

title: Mapillary, the crowdsourced database of street-level imagery, has been acquired by Facebook
text: Mapillary, the Swedish startup that wants to take on Google and others in mapping the world via a crowdsourced database of street-level imagery, has been acquired by Facebook, according to the company’s blog. Terms of deal aren’t being disclosed.

title: Facebook commits $200 million to Black-owned businesses and organizations
text: Facebook on Thursday announced it will commit $200 million to Black-owned businesses and organizations.

title: Facebook Removes Trump Campaign Ads With Nazi Concentration Camp Symbol
text: The symbol was used by Nazis to identify political prisoners.

title: Facebook removes Trump campaign ads featuring Nazi symbol
text: Facebook removed a cluster of Trump campaign ads Thursday for violating its rules against imagery associated with banned hate groups. The campaign’s attacked antifa, the decentralized anti-fascist movement and a frequent target of the president’s political attacks, with imagery of an upside-down red triangle—a well-documented symbol worn by Nazi political prisoners held in concentration camps.

title: Facebook takes down Trump re-election ad featuring hate symbol
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on why Facebook has removed President Trump's election advertisements.

title: Facebook sues individuals for offering to scrape data, gather likes
text: Facebook said on Thursday it filed lawsuits against individuals in Europe and the US for abusing its platforms to offer automated tools for scraping users’ personal data and gathering likes. The social network said the defendant in the US lawsuit operated a data scraping service, called “Massroot8,” which improperly collected data by asking users to.

title: Facebook removes Trump ads containing symbols used by Nazis to identify political prisoners
text: The ads contained red downward-pointing triangles, which the Nazis used to mark political prisoners.

title: Facebook Removes Trump Campaign Ads That Featured Symbol Once Used By Nazis
text: Facebook said that is has removed an ad from President Donald Trump’s reelection campaign that featured an upside down red triangle, a symbol that was once used by Nazis to identify political prisoners. “We removed these posts and ads for violating our policy against organized hate,” said Andy Stone, a Facebook spokesman. “Our policy prohibits

title: Facebook removes Trump ads that included markings used by Nazis
text: Facebook FB, +0.01% said Thursday it has removed ads by President Donald Trump's reelection campaign that broke the company's policy against "organized hate.

title: Facebook, Google and Twitter tell lawmakers they're doing more to safeguard elections
text: Officials from all three companies say they've learned from previous elections but lawmakers are still skeptical.

title: Facebook takes down Trump ads 'for violating our policy against organized hate'
text: Facebook on Thursday said it had take action against ads run by President Trump's re-election campaign for breaching its policies on hate. The ads, which attacked what the Trump campaign described as "Dangerous MOBS of far-left groups," featured an upside-down triangle.

title: The NAACP And Other Civil Rights Organizations Call for Companies to Drop Facebook Ads
text: Derrick Johnson, President and CEO of the NAACP sits down with Cheddar to discuss the organization's call to cut ad spending on Facebook, holding social media companies accountable and what the federal government can do to combat systemic racism in policing.

title: Facebook sues developer over alleged data scraping abuse
text: The alleged data scraper took login credentials from about 5,500 people, and then harvested phone numbers of their friends, the lawsuit claimed.

title: Ex-Facebook VP thinks governments will go after Big Tech and break them up within a decade
text: Former Facebook executive Chamath Palihapitiya told the CB Insights conference that regulators are going to come down hard on Big Tech in the next 10 years.

title: Facebook to Report on Its Privacy Efforts to the FTC
text: The social media giant will also hire an outside party to assess its privacy practices.

title: Anti-Defamation League CEO calls for advertisers to boycott Facebook
text: On Wednesday, six organizations, including the Anti-Defamation League and the NAACP, announced a new campaign urging global corporations to stop advertising on Facebook for the month of July.

title: 'The Decision Is Ours Alone' Says FCC Commissioner Geoffrey Starks Regarding Trump's Social Media Executive Order
text: Commissioner Geoffrey Starks dismissed President Donald Trump’s executive order saying the Federal Communications Commission should stay clear of the debate on the liability of social media platforms for the content posted on them.

title: Former US chief technology officer on DOJ proposal to limit Big Tech protections
text: The Justice Department introduced a proposal that would roll back legal protection for social media companies, which would ultimately change the way content is policed.

title: Facebook Stock Facing Bumpy Ride: Politics Factoring In
text: Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) stock and the company itself are again at the center of controversy and increasing calls into its business practices. The company is no stranger to having accusations of being an anti-competitive monopoly levied at it.

title: Apple Rejects Facebook’s Gaming App, for at Least the Fifth Time
text: Apple has repeatedly denied Facebook’s new Gaming app from appearing in its App Store, citing its own rules.

title: Former Facebook exec thinks big tech will get broken up “over the next 10 years”
text: Investor Chamath Palihapitiya made part of his fortune at Facebook, where he was a vice president for more than four years, leaving roughly one year before the company’s 2012 IPO. He also thinks that Facebook, no matter its failings, has played an active role in enabling users to collect, report, and disseminate important information, particularly […]
